Name: AppointmentStatus
Title: AppointmentStatus
Description: The free/busy status of an appointment.

Name: CarePlanActivityStatus
Title: CarePlanActivityStatus
Description: Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

Name: EncounterLocationStatus
Title: EncounterLocationStatus
Description: The status of the location.

Name: EncounterStatus
Title: EncounterStatus
Description: Current state of the encounter.

Name: EventStatus
Title: EventStatus
Description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of an event.

Name: GoalLifecycleStatus
Title: GoalLifecycleStatus
Description: Codes that reflect the current state of a goal and whether the goal is still being targeted.

Name: ObservationStatus
Title: ObservationStatus
Description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

Name: ParticipantRequired
Title: ParticipantRequired
Description: Is the Participant required to attend the appointment.

Name: ParticipationStatus
Title: ParticipationStatus
Description: The Participation status of an appointment.

Name: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
Title: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
Description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire response.

Name: RequestIntent
Title: RequestIntent
Description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a request.

Name: RequestPriority
Title: RequestPriority
Description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

Name: RequestStatus
Title: RequestStatus
Description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a request.

Name: ResourceType
Title: ResourceType
Description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

Name: SNOMED_CT
Title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
Description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

Name: AdmitSource
Title: Admit source
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate from where the patient came in.

Name: AppointmentCancellationReason
Title: Appointment cancellation reason
Description: This example value set defines a set of reasons for the cancellation of an appointment.

Name: ConditionClinicalStatusCodes
Title: Condition Clinical Status Codes
Description: Preferred value set for Condition Clinical Status.

Name: ConditionVerificationStatus
Title: ConditionVerificationStatus
Description: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

Name: DataAbsentReason
Title: DataAbsentReason
Description: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing.

Name: DiagnosisRole
Title: Diagnosis Role
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to express the role of a diagnosis on the Encounter or EpisodeOfCare record.

Name: Diet
Title: Diet
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate dietary preferences or restrictions a patient may have.

Name: DischargeDisposition
Title: Discharge disposition
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to where the patient left the hospital.

Name: SpecialArrangements
Title: Special arrangements
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the kinds of special arrangements in place for a patients visit.

Name: EncounterType
Title: Encounter type
Description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the type of encounter: a specific code indicating type of service provided.

Name: GoalAchievementStatus
Title: Goal achievement status
Description: Describes the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

Name: GoalCategory
Title: Goal category
Description: Codes for grouping goals to use for filtering or presentation.

Name: GoalPriority
Title: Goal priority
Description: Indicates the level of importance associated with reaching or sustaining a goal.

Name: LocationType
Title: Location type
Description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the physical form of the Location.  This includes several 'non physical' codes which are still considered a location.

Name: ObservationCategoryCodes
Title: Observation Category Codes
Description: Observation Category codes.

Name: ParticipantType
Title: Participant type
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate how an individual participates in an encounter.

Name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
Title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
Description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

Name: ServiceCategory
Title: Service category
Description: This value set defines an example set of codes that can be used to classify groupings of service-types/specialties.

Name: ServiceType
Title: Service type
Description: This value set defines an example set of codes of service-types.

Name: ReAdmissionIndicator
Title: re-admissionIndicator
Description: Code system of concepts which are used to specify that a patient is being re admitted to a healthcare facilityin from which they were discharged, and indicates the circumstances around such re-admission.  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messagine in the PV1 segment.

Name: AppointmentReason
Title: appointmentReason
Description: Code system of concepts used to describe the kind of appointment or the reason why an appointment has been scheduled.  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the ARQ segment.

Name: ActCode
Title: ActCode
Description: A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.    *Constraints:* The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems. The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc.    Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure.    Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.

Name: ActPriority
Title: ActPriority
Description: A set of codes (e.g., for routine, emergency), specifying the urgency under which the Act happened, can happen, is happening, is intended to happen, or is requested/demanded to happen.

Name: EncounterSpecialCourtesy
Title: EncounterSpecialCourtesy
Description: **** MISSING DESCRIPTION ****

Name: NullFlavor
Title: NullFlavor
Description: A collection of codes specifying why a valid value is not present.

Name: ObservationInterpretation
Title: ObservationInterpretation
Description: One or more codes providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation, such as "normal" / "abnormal", "low" / "high", "better" / "worse", "resistant" / "susceptible", "expected" / "not expected". The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.

Name: ParticipationType
Title: ParticipationType
Description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every Participation instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints on the Roles undertaking the participation.

Name: RoleCode
Title: RoleCode
Description: A set of codes further specifying the kind of Role; specific classification codes for further qualifying RoleClass codes.

Name: BeCSProblemCategory
Title: Problem Category
Description: Problem Category

Name: BeCSProblemOriginType
Title: Problem Origin Type
Description: Problem Origin Type

Name: BeCSScore
Title: Score Code System
Description: Codes as defined initially by the NIHDI. Dutch translations were not yet defined but are planned   for a next release.

Name: BeCSScoreCategory
Title: Score Category
Description: Score Category
